Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Lemon Arrow’ delivers an intense, pure lemon flavor with a crisp, succulent texture and a clean finish free of metallic aftertaste. The leaves are distinctively arrow-shaped, glossy, and medium green with prominent veining, growing in upright clusters from a central crown. The plant forms a dense, self-supporting mound that remains attractive and productive through multiple seasons.

2. The Natural Citrus Seasoning This sorrel’s powerful acidity and bright flavor make it an exceptional finishing herb and flavor enhancer.

  • Soup and Sauce Finisher: The classic use - finely chopped and stirred into creamy soups, sauces, and pan drippings at the last moment to add instant brightness.
  • Salad Citrus Replacement: Can replace lemon juice or vinegar in salad dressings when blended into vinaigrettes, providing both acidity and fresh green notes.
  • Fish and Seafood Partner: A natural companion to fatty fish and seafood, where its acidity cuts through richness perfectly.
  • Compound Butter and Spreads: Chopped and mixed into butter, cream cheese, or yogurt for instant citrus-herb spreads.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Lemon Arrow’ is a cut-and-come-again perennial that becomes more productive with regular harvesting. Pick individual leaves from the outside of the plant, or cut entire stems 5 cm above the crown. Supplied as a pre-seeded RFID Seed-Pad Cartridges, it provides a consistent yield of 15-25 intensely flavored leaves per week, with harvests possible year-round in protected balcony conditions.
